p: While a dramatic reduction in malaria-related deaths was seen in the early part of this century, progress has halted since 2015 ( Bhatt et al., 2015; Feachem et al., 2019), and models predict that elimination is not possible in the majority of disease-endemic countries with currently available tools ( Walker et al., 2016). The burden of other vector-borne diseases is on the rise, with dengue incidence and mortality increasing in much of the world ( Stanaway et al., 2016), Zika recently sweeping through Latin America and the Caribbean ( Oâ€™Reilly et al., 2018), and the mosquito species responsible for vectoring these diseases, Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus, greatly expanding their geographic range ( Kraemer et al., 2015; Lee et al., 2019).
